Package com.worizon.jsonrpc.annotations

This package contains annotations for the facade Rpc proxy api.

See: Description

  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    RemoteProcName
    This annotation explicit changes the remote method name to be called.

Package com.worizon.jsonrpc.annotations Description

This package contains annotations for the facade Rpc proxy api. An interface in order to be exported and used as a remote procedure must be anotated with @Remote annotation. By default the remote procedure name that will be called is the one of the method's. This behaviour can be overriden with the @ProcName annotation. This annotation lets you define a different name than the method's name on which the remote call will be targeted. Ex: @ProcName("get_users") public void getUsers(); getusers() ==> {jsonrpc:"2.0", method:"get_users", id:88678} The annotation @RemoteParams is used for remote calls with named parameters, if this annotation is not supplied then the invocation is performed with numbered parameters. Ex: public int substract(int x, int y); substract(76,23); ==> {jsonrpc:"2.0", method:"substract", params:[76,23], id:88678} @RemoteParams({"x","y"}) public int sum(int x, int y); sum(76,23); ==> {jsonrpc:"2.0", method:"sum", params:{x:76,y:23}, id:88678}
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
Enric Cecilla
